answers.answer: I don't think you can undrop. I think once baby has dropped he/she is there to stay until delivery

Well she's head down and dr said probably won't turn back around which is good and last appointment she said head is nice an low already making her way but from the outside, I don't look as low as I did. When sitting upright I could feel the weight of my bump in my lap and now it restricts upwards more like it used to when I started showing.

question: I was dropping and noticing it little by little but today I have, for lack if better term or knowledge, undropped. I don't think I went all the way back up but at least halfway from where I was and where I dropped to. Is this supposed to happen? I didn't have this happen with my first an I know all pregnancies are different but I'm so worried about a c-section this time around from gestational diabetes that everything seriously concerns me now. Has anyone else had this? I'm 36+3 today
title: I've....undropped?
